newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippine peso ends shade up on steep rate hike.
newsitem.headline: Philippine peso ends shade up on steep rate hike.

text.p: The Philippine peso ended a shade up on Friday at 26.374 to the dollar from 26.375 after the Central Bank made a bold move to raise its overnight borrowing rate by seven percentage points to 20 percent, traders said.
The peso had reached a high of 26.368 in midsession on Friday after the rate hike. But speculators weakened the peso again in anticipation of a cut in the overnight rate.
"Foreign funds were already flowing in after the rate hike. There was no pressure on the exchange rate. So what do you need the 20 percent overnight rate for," a dealer said.
The speculation prompted the Philippine Central Bank to say it was keeping its overnight borrowing rate at 20 percent to punish speculators.

The peso had been under attack due to the spillover effects of the crisis in the Thai baht. This forced the Central Bank to raise its overnight borrowing rate by a total of 8.75 percentage points in two days.
